triggers.name: Firmware has changed
triggers.description:
Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.
Firmware version has changed. Ack to close

triggers.name: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
triggers.description:
Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.
Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

items.name: Overall system health status
items.description:
MIB: SW-MIB
The current operational status of the switch.The states are as follow:
online(1) means the switch is accessible by an external  Fibre Channel port
offline(2) means the switch is not accessible
testing(3) means the switch is in a built-in test mode and is not accessible by an external Fibre Channel port
faulty(4) means the switch is not operational.

triggers.name: System status is in critical state
triggers.description:
Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.
Please check the device for errors

triggers.name: System status is in warning state
triggers.description:
Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.
Please check the device for warnings

dependencies.name: System status is in critical state

trigger_prototypes.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Fan is in critical state
trigger_prototypes.description:
Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.
Please check the fan unit

trigger_prototypes.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Power supply is in critical state
trigger_prototypes.description:
Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.
Please check the power supply unit for errors

item_prototypes.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Admin status
item_prototypes.description:
The desired state of the port. A management station might place the
port in a desired state by setting this object accordingly.

trigger_prototypes.name: Admin status of port {#SNMPVALUE} is changed

item_prototypes.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Brocade type of port
item_prototypes.description: This string indicates the Brocade port type.

item_prototypes.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Number of Class 3 frames that the port has discarded
item_prototypes.description: Counts the number of Class 3 frames that the port has discarded.

trigger_prototypes.name: Number of Class 3 frames that the port has discarded on $1 on {HOSTNAME} is increased

item_prototypes.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Operational status
item_prototypes.description: The operational status of the port.

trigger_prototypes.name: Operational status of port {#SNMPVALUE} is changed

item_prototypes.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Physical state
item_prototypes.description: The physical state of the port.

trigger_prototypes.name: Module in port {#SNMPVALUE} is receiving light but is out of sync on {HOSTNAME}. Check the module installation
Physical state of the port {#SNMPVALUE} is changed

item_prototypes.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Number of invalid ordered sets received
item_prototypes.description: Counts the number of invalid ordered sets received.

trigger_prototypes.name: Number of invalid ordered sets received on $1 on {HOSTNAME} is increased

item_prototypes.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Number of CRC errors detected for frames received
item_prototypes.description: Counts the number of CRC errors detected for frames received.

trigger_prototypes.name: Number of CRC errors detected for frames received on $1 on {HOSTNAME} is increased

item_prototypes.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Number of encoding error or disparity error inside frames received
item_prototypes.description:
Counts the number of encoding error or disparity error inside frames
received.

trigger_prototypes.name: Number of encoding error or disparity error inside frames received on $1 on {HOSTNAME} is increased

item_prototypes.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Number of encoding error or disparity error outside frames received
item_prototypes.description:
Counts the number of encoding error or disparity error outside frames
received.

trigger_prototypes.name: Number of encoding error or disparity error outside frames received on $1 on {HOSTNAME} is increased

item_prototypes.name: {#SNMPVALUE}:Number of FC words received
item_prototypes.description:
Counts the number of Fibre Channel words that the port has received.
You can convert words to bytes by multiplying this value by 4.

item_prototypes.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Media transmitter type
item_prototypes.description: Indicates the media transmitter type of the port.

item_prototypes.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Number of FC words transmitted
item_prototypes.description:
Counts the number of Fibre Channel words that the port has
transmitted. You can convert words to bytes by multiplying this value
by 4.

item_prototypes.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Type of ASIC
item_prototypes.description: The type of ASIC for the switch port.

trigger_prototypes.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:""}
trigger_prototypes.description:
Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.
This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototypes.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:""}
trigger_prototypes.description:
Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.
This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available
